DOC.HEAD: Two Indians Executed for Killing Egyptian
DOC.TEXT: Two Indians were beheaded Friday for the murder of an Egyptian, the Interior Ministry said. Saudi Arabia is governed by Islamic law that prescribes beheading for murder, the cutting off of a hand for theft and stoning for adultery. In recent years the death penalty also has been applied to drug smugglers. Executions of criminals convicted by Islamic courts are a common occurrence on Fridays in Saudi Arabia. The beheadings are carried out in public squares opposite mosques after Moslem Sabbath congregational prayers. The announcement said the two Indians, whose names were given in Arabic as Lingia Buhoma Bontor and Makla Kanka Malaya, fatally beat the Egyptian Abdul-Hameed bin Mohammed bin Oweiss during a robbery attempt. The crime, trial and beheadings took place in Najran, on the western side of the desert kingdom.
